events.name: nextAvailableIdentifier
events.comment: Stores the next available identifier, to be assigned to equipment

children.title: everything
children.description: all objects in the game world: the player, enemies and props

actions.text: create shadows for everything that has one
we can't use the alpha clamp layer effect, since we want to change the layer's opacity

actions.text: request the project JSON files via AJAX, and set fullscreen
randomly set the 'animation' (i.e. the image) of the specified props. This will give the map some originality and save us from having to set it manually.

map function mods - equipment mods

children.title: AJAX
children.description: Turn JSON files into usable arrays, and generate applicable probability tables

children.functionDescription: look up a value in an array

actions.text: pick the array that was passed (the calling event might not pick it, so we can't use "copy picked")
loop through the column headers to find the columns we want
"stop loop" doesn't work with the array loops. using a standard loop with arrays.width wasn't working either for some reason
this line cannot be combined into the previous line

loop through the cells of just that column to find the value we want, skipping the header row. Once we find it, set returnValue to the value of the cell located in that row but column of targetColumnNumber
once we have a return value, stop the loop (we're not sure if setting a return value also ends the function)
this event needs to be above the sorting group to prevent a graphical glitch

children.name: sortingMethod
children.comment: chained "else" statements check various conditions to determine proper sort order

actions.text: somehow the default 'head' is spawning before player's sprite's name can be referenced. this 'wait 0' fixes that.
these events to spawn default gear need to be nested, and I don't know why

children.title: facings
children.description: our standard degree formula. We may be able to sprinkle in 'trigger once's here for minor performance gains.

actions.text: this is a function so it can be called in the middle of an ability function
if the player exists, set the orbs to the correct values and scroll them
if the orb's height gets set before the players health and mana values are loaded, it'll divide by zero and its height will be NaN
Don't let the Player's Mana or Health exceed the maximum
regen health and mana while not at max

children.title: movement
children.description: left button is down, on pathfinding found, on moveto arrived, while moving

children.text: this unfortunately runs every tick but the alternatives were causing issues

actions.text: ...if they're moving, set their animation appropriately
...if they're moving, set their animation appropriately

children.title: animations
children.description: on any animation finished, function updateAnimations

actions.text:
https://github.com/Laserwolve/DaggerQuest/issues/23
https://github.com/Scirra/Construct-3-bugs/issues/5895
To completely get rid of the incorrect height and width values, we need to have this run every tick, however, there's no actual different outcome
when any animation that's not "die" finishes, play the idle animation. 'MoveTo is moving - playing walking animation' overrides this.
startPoint is a string because it needs to get passed from an ability
branching trees, based on the start point, and if the player is armed or not

children.text: the parenthesis are important to separate the ORs and the ANDs

actions.text: this has to be done after the animation is set, so it goes in a blank event, instead of repeating it

events.title: menus
events.description: open and close menus on key press

actions.text: when left click is released over a skill slot...
...and it's an ability skill slot, open the ability selector and record which ability was clicked on
then set the options icons accordingly, after clearing them
...if it's an option skill slot, record its skill and type
do something based on which text/link we clicked on
this wait prevents us from walking to where the 'resume' button is

children.title: tooltip
children.description: cursor is over item, cursor is not over item

actions.text: set the color of the level and class restrictions text box depending if the player can use them. (evaluate with or operator wasn't working)

children.text: moving the cursor from one item or loot to another in the same tick would result in an incorrect tooltip showing up. Making the tooltip process a function that's called by these events resolves that issue.

actions.text: while the tooltip is being displayed...
...check if there's not enough space to the right of the mouse to fit the tooltip...
...and not enough space below the mouse either. move the tooltip up and to the left
...just move it to the left
if there's enough space to the left but not below, offset it upwards only
if it's in an OK spot just show the tooltip like normal
while the tooltip is being displayed...
...check if there's not enough space to the right of the mouse to fit the tooltip...
...and not enough space below the mouse either. move the tooltip up and to the left
...just move it to the left
if there's enough space to the left but not below, offset it upwards only
if it's in an OK spot just show the tooltip like normal
you can only open game menus when the game isn't paused

children.name: swapID
children.comment: the identifier of the equipped item, so we can swap it

children.name: swapSlotUID
children.comment: the UID of the original slot in a swap

children.name: draggedOriginSlotUID
children.comment: the UID of the slot the drag originated from

children.name: dragCacheItemUID
children.comment: the UID of the item we're dragging

children.name: gearToSpawn
children.comment: the expression of the gear to spawn

children.name: dragCacheSlotUID
children.comment: the UID of the slot we dropped on

children.title: loot management
children.description: on enemy destroyed, on left click on loot, setItemVariables function

actions.text: spawn loot: set the drop table {based on the drop table of the chest opened or the enemy slain}, spawn the equipment loot {at the location of the chest or dead enemy}
assign stats to the loot based on the total of its base numbers {and random modifiers}. Give it a identifier, and then increment the next available identifier

children.functionDescription: Picking up loot and turning it into an item

actions.text: if auto equip is enabled, and the player's class matches the loot's restrictions, pick the first empty slot matching the loot's type, and spawn the item there
we need to wait 0 seconds for the item to actually be created, so we can reference it in "manageGear"
if auto equip is disabled, or there's no empty slots matching the item's type, spawn the item in the first empty inventory slot.

children.functionDescription: set the variables on an item, from its loot

children.title: item management
children.description: on right click on item, on item drag start, on item drop, function attachItem, function detachItem

actions.text: if an item is right clicked
and both the inventory and character menus are open, pick the slot the item is in
if the item is in the character menu
check to see if there's any empty inventory slots the item can go into
if there are, detach the item from its current slot
then attach it to the first empty inventory slot
if the item is in the inventory menu, and doesn't have class restrictions
pick the slots that match the item's type
of those slots, check if any are empty
now that we know there's an empty character slot for this item, go back to the slot holding our item, and detach
re-pick the first empty character slot that matches the item's type, and attach to it
if no slots are empty, start the *swap*: pick the first slot and store its identifier, which is also the identifier of the item in it
go back to the slot holding our item, and detach. save this slots UID so we know where to put the other item
for some reason this isn't a function and I'm too scared to change it to one
re-pick the first character slot that matches the item's type, and attach to it, even though it has an different item in it

now we have both items in the same slot. we'll detach the item that shouldn't be there, picking it with swapID. We don't need to clear the identifier value because it was already set correctly in the previous event
it'll go where the other item left, which we have saved in previousLocationUID
when an item starts being dragged, record where it came from, set dragging to true, detach it, and move it to the overlay layer
if it came from a character slot, manage the gear appropriately
when we drop the item, set dragging to false
if the cursor was over a slot
and the item can't go into that slot, because of the wrong slot or wrong class
send the item back to the slot it came from
if it came from a character slot, manage the gear and mods appropriately
and that slot was a character slot that matches the item's type, or is "none"
and that slot is empty, attach the item to it
if it came from a character slot, manage the gear and mods appropriately
and that slot is not empty, save its identifier (which is also its item's identifier) so we can overwrite it
check if the item can go back to the origin slot
if it can, re-pick the item being dragged, and the slot we dropped it on, and attach them
if it came from a character slot, manage the gear and mods appropriately
now pick and detach the overlapped item that shouldn't be there (but the slot's identifier is OK), and pick the origin slot, and attach the two
if it came from a character slot, manage the gear and mods appropriately
if it can't, don't swap, and send the item being dragged back to the origin slot
if it came from a character slot, manage the gear and mods appropriately
if the cursor was over an invalid location, send the item back to the slot it came from
if it came from a character slot, manage the gear and mods appropriately
if the cursor was over the game world background, spawn its loot
transfer data from item to loot, then destroy the item

children.functionDescription: attaches an item to a slot
detaches an item from a slot

children.title: gear management
children.description: function manageGear, on image loading complete, function destroyGear, function setGearVariables

children.functionDescription: give a gear the correct type and z order values after it spawns

actions.text: "pick last created object" doesn't work, so pick the gear by its name

children.functionDescription: handle the spawning and destroying of gear

actions.text: WARNING: the order in which things process gets very tricky with triggers, functions and wait 0s. Edit with care!
as long as the slot's type is not neck or ring...
if it's empty...
pick the gear that correlates with the slot's type
if it's mainHand, offHand, feet, or hands (the slots that have visual representation but no default gear), just destroy the relevant gear
if it was a mainHand or offHand, we'll need to update animations to not play armed animations
if it's chest, legs, or head (the slots with visual representation that have default gear), load the default gear
if there's no gear, that means the game has just started, and we just need to spawn default gear
if it's not empty...
pick the item that's currently in that slot
pick the gear that correlates with the slot's type (there might not be one)
if there wasn't any gear for that slot already, we can just spawn the new one easy peasy  THE MUSTARD SEED
these 3 events HAVE to be in an "on image loading complete" event to prevent the gear from flashing its default animation on load
when gear is created, add it as a child to the player to keep it always in the same place

children.functionDescription: destroy gear, and unload it from memory

actions.text: set a random facing on spawn, and spawn the enemy's body
if they have line of sight, they may or may not also be in range
if they're not in range, they may or may not have line of sight
if the player isn't in range, walk to a random location inside the player
if the player is in range...

find us a random nearby location
TODO: minimum distance so they don't walk 1 pixel away
walk there, provided it's not in or behind a solid
this can't be nested under "is moving", also we need the "push out" or else the enemy can just walk into the enemy next tick/idle move
enemies have to be immediately pushed totally out of the player, otherwise the player will lose control
pick enemies that are dead, and their bodies that aren't playing the dying animation. Immediately stop their movement and disabled solids, and play the die animation
we couldn't get the "fade" behavior to work, most likely because all our enemyBodies are created during runtime
if we're on the last frame of a die animation, reduce the opacity by 1 (every tick)
stop the die animation (on the last frame) if we haven't already)
destroy dead enemies that are fully opaque. also destroys the enemyBody because they're parented
don't check for transparency overlaps every tick. also since the player shape changes minutely during animations don't wig out if we're very close to a transparent

children.text: even though the doors only have 1 animation, we still have to "set" it to get it to work right. (Play and Stop don't work)
